üëé
Hey there, {{user_name}} - I don't know if we've been fully introduced. I‚Äôm Faber, I run the Maker Space out near the Observatory.
It‚Äôs always great to have another new student around - Say, do you like shortbread?
Awesome! I‚Äôll double my recipe next time I make some. Can‚Äôt wait for you to try it.
That‚Äôs cool - Let me know what your favorite cookie is, we can try a batch in my solar oven some time!
Anyway, if you‚Äôre interested in making physical things -  you know, stuff with lights, switches, servos, wheels...
Stop by the Maker Space and take a look around. I‚Äôve got a ton of cool projects planned, and I'm sure you can help.
If you just want to just hang out, that‚Äôs cool too. Bring your favorite music and we can make mixes‚Ä¶ or just jam out.
...And maybe you can stop by the Observatory, too, while you‚Äôre over there.
Hi, Estelle! This is our newest student, I was just telling them about the Maker Space.
I'm sure there were cookies involved, too. You've got a clever way of making sure everyone sees what you've got going on out there.
Hey, just trying to make the trip worth it for everyone. You know, if all you wanted was to bring more people out, you could help me design a transport system‚Ä¶
Knowing you, Faber, you'd be trying to get me to build some kind of rocket-powered train.
Hey, they say to use what you know, and you know rockets! I've seen your welds before - superb.
It *is* always nice to have your work complimented, but these days I investigate the stars mainly through a telescope.
And your simulations, of course - what's the latest?
It's still running - I launched a probe on a long-track slingshot out beyond the heliopause - it should only take a week or so more, I think.
That's past the edge of the solar system! Got any theories about what you'll find?
I do - but I'm not saying anything until I see the data. No evidence, no conclusion.
See, now that sounds just like Saniel.
That reminds me, do you know where he is? I need to adjust some settings on my simulation cluster and find some more disk space‚Ä¶
Did you check the bottom of the Archives? I heard him talking about setting up a hammock down there. He said it was because the furnace provided ideal white noise for napping...
...I think he's just trying to find a spot the cats won't steal.
I should have guessed  - and to think that when we first met, I thought he'd grow out of that 'napping thing.' I'll look there. See you later, Faber.
Estelle‚Äôs been here since the the Academy‚Äôs founding. It's easy to feel intimidated around her, even though she's so nice.
Just seeing her reminds me there‚Äôs always some way I can improve or something I can learn more about. It's great motivation!
I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve got somewhere to be, but it was great to meet you. See you around!
